Typing: Press enter or desired key to execute command
Rowing: Sit on the rowing machine and secure feet
Grab the handle with both hands and lean forward
Pull the handle toward you while leaning back and extending legs
Punch: Rotate your hips, shoulders, and elbow
Extend your arm and make contact with the target
High Jump: Approach the bar with correct form
Jump off one foot and drive opposite knee upward
Extend your body and arch your back to clear the bar
Hand Stand Pushups: Get into a handstand position against a wall
Slowly lower yourself until your head almost touches the ground
Push yourself back up to the starting position
Nunchucks: Hold one stick in each hand
Twirl one stick around and grasp it
Swing the second stick and repeat the twirl with the other hand
Cliff Diving: Jump off the edge, pushing off with your feet
Maintain proper form and enter the water feet first
Swing: Grasp onto the swing with your hands
Release the swing and jump off at the desired time
Frisbee Catch: Determine the direction and speed of the Frisbee
Extend arms and hands and catch the Frisbee at the highest point possible
Sumo Wrestling: Stand in the middle of the ring and face your opponent
Lunge at your opponent, using your body weight to push them out of the ring
Push your opponent down to the ground or force them out of the ring
Yo Yo: Hold the yo-yo with your palm facing up
Throw the yo-yo downwards and release
Pull the yo-yo upwards while simultaneously lifting your throwing hand to bring it back up
Lunges: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart
Take a step forward with one leg and bend that knee to a 90-degree angle
Push down with the heel of the front foot and lift the heel of the back foot as you stand up
Clean And Jerk: Start with the barbell on the ground and hands gripping the bar shoulder-width apart
Lift the bar from the ground to the shoulders in one fluid motion
In a split second motion, push the bar upwards and split your legs to catch the bar with arms extended above your head
Skate Boarding: Stand with your leading foot on the skateboard and push off the ground
Shift your weight while bending your knees to steer the skateboard
Come to a stop by slowing down or using your foot to brake the skateboard
Rope Climbing: Stand in front of the rope and jump to reach it
Grab the rope and use your feet to grip and climb up
Reach the top and ring the bell or touch the ceiling
Playing Piano: Sit on the piano bench with correct posture and hand position
Press keys corresponding to desired notes or chords
Maintain the rhythm and tempo while following the sheet music or playing by ear
Tennis Swing: Start with a good athletic stance with your feet shoulder-width apart
Switch your weight to your back foot
Step forward and swing the racquet forward with your arm above your head
Juggling Balls: Start with two balls in your dominant hand and one in your non-dominant hand
Toss the first ball in your dominant hand to your other hand
As the first ball reaches its peak, toss the second ball from your non-dominant hand to your dominant hand
Military Parade: March in a straight line with a group of people
Maintain the correct spacing between individuals
Execute precise turns and maneuvers when directed by the leader
Haircut: Comb the hair to remove tangles and knots
Use scissors or clippers to trim the hair according to the desired length and style
Clean the hair and the surrounding space of cut hair fragments
Volleyball Spiking: Approach the ball by taking three steps back followed by a forward 3-step approach
Jump upwards and raise one arm with a bended elbow
Snap the wrist and hit the top of the ball to send it downwards to the opposing teams side
Soccer Penalty: Place the ball on the penalty spot
Take three to four steps back and one to the side
Run forwards and kick the ball towards the goal, aiming for an empty spot past the goalkeeper
Floor Gymnastics: Start with a standing position and prepare for desired routine
Execute floor movements to perform tricks and moves
Finish with a controlled landing and pose that displays confident and stable balance
Billiards: Position the cue ball for the desired shot
Strike the cue ball with the pool stick, aiming for the desired target ball
Sink the targeted ball into the pocket
Cricket Bowling: Grip the cricket ball with the four fingers across the seam and thumb underneath the ball
Take a few steps backwards followed by a few steps forward
Push off with the front foot and bring the arm forward while releasing the ball with a spin towards the wicket
Hammering: Position the nail on the surface with your nondominant hand
Hold the hammer in your dominant hand and swing it backwards
Bring the hammer forwards, striking the nail while maintaining control and avoiding damage to the surrounding area
Cutting In Kitchen: Place the desired food item on a cutting board
Pick up a knife with your dominant hand
Cut the food item using the knife with your desired technique, ensuring your fingers are clear of the blade
Shotput: Stand at the back of the circle with the shotput pressed to your neck.
Take a swift and explosive push off the ground with one leg while hurling the shotput at the desired angle
Maintain proper posture and technique for maximum accuracy and distance
Playing Tabla: Begin the taal by striking the dayan with the small finger and middle finger of your stronger hand
Play the bols by using the fingers and palms to produce desired sounds and rhythms
Execute the kaida or rela by improvising based on rhythm and technique
Mopping Floor: Fill a bucket with water and the desired cleaning solution
Dip the mop into the bucket and wring out excess water
Mop the desired area in a systematic and consistent manner
Hammer Throw: Start by winding up the hammer around your head
Turn your body quickly in the opposite direction to build momentum
Release the hammer at the right moment and at the angle you want the hammer to go
Fencing: Start with both feet shoulder-width apart and bend at the knees into en garde position
Thrust the foil toward the opponent, aiming for points that will give you a win
Deflect oncoming attacks with swift parries
Trampoline Jumping: Start with a small jump to get momentum
Use your core to spring upwards and control your height and position
Land in a controlled manner with feet and legs together
Archery: Steady your elbow on the bowstring to maintain grip
Draw the arrow from the quiver and place it on the bowstring
Aim at the desired target and release the bowstring while maintaining aim
Rafting: Determine the course of your desired route
Identify dangerous rapids or obstacles to navigate around
Paddle or steer the raft with effective teamwork to ensure safety and an enjoyable experience
Writing On Board: Hold the marker at its base
Write legibly in the desired text, ensuring the writing is visible to viewers
Erase the writing or make any changes as needed
Javelin Throw: Hold the javelin parallel to the ground and behind your shoulder
Run forward and plant your foot while lowering your arm
Whip the javelin forward while releasing it at the desired angle
Bowling: Start with a good athletic stance
Take a few steps forward and release the ball with a smooth swing of the arm
Drumming: Hold drumsticks with a loose grip
Strike the drumhead in the desired sequence to produce steady rhythm
Include fills or breaks by moving sticks around drums
Skijet: Mount the skijet and make any necessary adjustments
Accelerate and start moving forward while maintaining balance
Steer and adjust your speed accordingly while remaining aware of your surroundings
Pull Ups: Position yourself under the pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip
Pull your body up towards the bar
Lower your body until your arms are straight and repeat
Apply Lipstick: Choose a lipstick shade that complements your skin tone
Remove the cap of the lipstick
Start by outlining your lips with the lipstick and then apply color evenly in the remaining of your lips
Baby Crawling: Position your baby on their hands and knees
Encourage your baby to move their opposite hand and leg forward
Repeat this sequence of movements, alternating the limbs
Table Tennis Shot: Make your body and grip relaxed
Watch the ball intently as it approaches
Swing the paddle forward and connect with the ball at the correct angle for the desired shot
Long Jump: Run towards the line while keeping steady speed
Plant your take off foot and use the lever of the foot to move yourself forward
Keep your legs extending forward in front of your body and have a smooth landing
Body Weight Squats: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and toes slightly pointed out
Bend at the knees and hips, lowering the body
Push through the heels and extension the legs to return to the starting position
Mixing: Prepare ingredients as needed to start recipe
Mix the ingredients by hand or with a mixer according to the desired instructions
Monitor and adjust the mixture as needed until desired consistency is achieved
Playing Dhol: Start with a basic dhol beat
Alternate between both sides of the dhol using the palm and fingers
Create different rhythm patterns by incorporating the base or treble beats
Tai Chi: Stand with feet shoulder with apart and arms at hanging sides
Follow the routine with slow and sweeping movements
Breathe deeply and steadily while executing the movements
Parallel Bars: Grip the bars tightly with both hands
Lift yourself up until arms are straight
Lower yourself down by bending your elbows and then repeat
Soccer Juggling: Start by kicking the ball up with one foot
Juggle the ball from one foot to the other
Use various tricks to keep the ball off the ground while maintaining good form and control
Cricket Shot: Position yourself in the appropriate stance
Focus on the bowler and anticipate the movement of the ball
Swing the bat in the desired direction to hit the ball and score a run
Pommel Horse: Start by facing the horse in a crouching position
Place both hands on the pommels and quickly lift one leg over the horse
Shift your weight across the horse while twisting and turning your body
Hula Hoop: Start by positioning the hula hoop around your waist
Rock your hips forward and backwards while keeping your upper body still
Maintain movement by swirling your hips in one or more directions to keep the hoop in motion
Playing Violin: Sit or stand with correct posture, holding the violin between your chin and shoulder
Place your fingers on the fingerboard to create the desired notes
Use the bow to play the strings with smooth and steady movements
Walking With Dog: Attach the leash to the dog’s collar or harness
Walk forward while holding the leash in your hand
Allow the dog to explore the surroundings while ensuring their safety and keeping them under control
Knitting: Choose a yarn and knitting needle appropriate for your desired project
Create a slipknot and slide it onto one needle
Loop the yarn over the needle and weave the needle through the loop to create a row of stitches
Boxing Speed Bag: Stand in front of the speed bag with good stance
Use your hands to strike the bag in a rhythmic pattern
Adjust your movements to the timing of the bag in order to maintain consistent strikes
Uneven Bars: Start with a hang on the high bar
Swing your legs forward and back to generate momentum
Release the high bar and perform moves on the low bar before re-grasping the high bar
Sky Diving: Start with 15-60 minutes of training and instruction
Wear proper gear including parachute and helmet
Jump off the plane and enjoy the exhilarating freefall before deploying the parachute and landing smoothly
Jumping Jack: Start in a straight standing position with feet together
Jump up and land with legs spread shoulder width wide and arms above your head
Jump again and bring your feet back together while lowering your arms
Shaving Beard: Wash your face with warm water and apply shaving cream
Hold the razor at a short angle and start shaving with the grain
After taking one stroke, rinse the blade in water and continue shaving until the desired smoothness is achieved
Salsa Spin: Start with a simple turn on the dance floor
Extend your arm and lead your partner forward in a fast spin
Use your upper body to quickly spin your partner before returning to basic steps
Brushing Teeth: Brush your teeth for 2 minutes, spending equal time on each quadrant
Wall Pushups: Stand facing a wall with feet shoulder-width apart
Place your hands on the wall with your arms straight
Bend your arms and bring your chest towards the wall while keeping your body straight, and then push back to the starting position
Baseball Pitch: Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands together
Take your hands behind your back and then bring them forward at chest height
Complete the pitch with a quick motion by projecting the ball forward
Horse Riding: Approach your horse calmly and confidently
Steady yourself on the horse and hold the reins with both hands
Gently kick the horse into motion with your heels and steer with your hands to direct the horse
Throw Discus: Hold the discus flat and firmly against your fingers
Start at the back of the ring and turn in a circular motion
Twist your body and release the discus at the desired angle and height
Push Ups: Assume a plank position with your arms and legs extended
Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows
Straighten your arms to push your body back up to the starting plank position
Field Hockey Penalty: Stand on the ball at the designated spot
Navigate around the ball to confuse the defending goalkeeper
Push or flick the ball towards the goal with the stick, attempting to score
Golf Swing: Stand beside the ball with your feet shoulder-width apart
Use your arms to hold the golf club and keep your grip relaxed
Swing the club with a fluid motion, aiming to hit the ball with the center of the club face
Jump Rope: Start by holding the jump rope with both hands
Spin the rope around your body, swinging it over your head and towards the ground
Jump as the rope approaches the ground, timing your jump to pass over the rope
Playing Cello: Press the fingers on the strings
Playing Flute: Press the fingers on the keys
Handstand Walking: Balance and walk on the hands
Lower the legs to end the handstand walk
Ice Dancing: Spin and twirl on the ice
Diving: Stand at the edge of the diving board
Enter the water and swim to the surface
Pole Vault: Plant the pole and take off
Clear the bar and fall to the mat
Kayaking: Paddle your way through the water
Apply Eye Makeup: Finish with mascara and false lashes
Bench Press: Lift the bar off the rack
Lower the bar to the chest
Press the bar to the starting position
Playing Guitar: Position the fingers on the frets
Pizza Tossing: Add sauce, cheese and other toppings
Surfing: Ride the wave to the shore
Playing Sitar: Press the fingers on the frets
Band Marching: Execute turns and stops as directed
